intro: Acer orientale var. ovale, commonly known as the oval-leaf maple, is a deciduous tree native to parts of East Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, ovate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in autumn. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by samaroid fruits. It typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and parks.
